title: Synced search history not staying deleted post-sync
content:
I have some search history results [not overall browsing history] of which i have tried repeatedly to delete via Shift+Del however even when i delete the history results while synced, they keep reappearing every time i log back in to sync my current data no matter how many times i try to delete them, if i could purge my synced data from the cloud [without purging what's already on my device] and upload a fresh batch of data to sync i would do it however the option does not exist so i need help on how to purge these search history results permanently, assuming the problem is not on your end.

And i have already deleted the results pages from my browsing history, so the issue couldn't be there from the start.
creator: j1kebritnell

title: Firefox not browsing, fails to open settings, crashes when resize
content:
I installed npm and then node js in windows 10. Later on the firefox was encounting error 0xc0000022 and could not browse at all.

I reinstalled firefox, problem remains.

Earlier when trying to browse it was opening a fail tab with a failure message (without code) but now it does not react when hit enter to browse.

mozglue.dll exists.

Somewhere I read Microsoft Visual Studio has some kind of dependencies and I tried to reinstall it. Firefox still does not browse.

I flushed dns. I reset winsock. I disabled network.http.http3.enabled from about:config
creator: pizza_pepperoni

title: Can't play content
content:
I am trying to play the content on this page https://www.itv.com/watch/long-lost-family/1a8904/1a8904a0080 and it says I can't . I use the help page it provides but the box it says to tick is already ticked...

Desktop Firefox browser

1. Go to about:preferences.

2. Scroll down to the "Digital Rights Management (DRM) Content" section.

3. Tick the "Play DRM-controlled content" box.

I did all the above and it still doesn't work. I am using the vpn so maybe that's it... I have my location set in London since its a Uk site.
creator: purplehonor82

title: Changing primary email account without sending to current primary email?
content:
My primary email account is my companies email. I no longer work at that company and do not have access to that email account.

When I attempt to change email to my personal, which is listed in the account, it requires that I enter a verification code that is sent to the current primary email.

Is there a work around for this, or should I delete the entire account and start again?
creator: mike.rebollo
